column4: Ubuntu does not start my keyboard nor mouse. I do have a serial connection using minicom. Anything I can do to fix the mouse+key problem?
By the looks of it the ports do not have power; the keyboard is wireless and normally the transmitter has a led on
Just some basic wired usb mouse
both usb
are the ports built in to the mobo, or are they on a daughter card
sudo mkdir /mnt/asdf;sudo mount -t auto /dev/device /mnt/asdf
try "cat boot.scr". if it looks fine, then use "nano boot.scr"
it looks weird. Is that utf-8?'V�8;NN��J$|

it may be a binary

bad idea
the only times you should ever sudo -i or su is if there is if there is no practical way to sudo-(^i).
No ideao what you are talking about. I was just editing the file with the root user because I can't edit it otherwise
anyways. i have 2 projects, a paper, and a book to read before school starts in 3 hours. so why am i on irc? beats me
your help is appreciated, I just did not understand the last part ;)
sudo will execute the next command as root. sudo -i and su will both log you in as the root user. those are more permanent than  sudo
make SURE to make a backup
